page.title: 02The Village of Beswick
page.content: The village of Beswick is situated along the A164 midway between Beverley and Driffield, map reference 05010448. The village is dominated by the Hall, standing to the west of the main street.Opposite the Hall, across the street, is the parish church of St. Margaret. There is also a small Methodist chapel in the village. There are presently no shops in Beswick. The former village shop and post office is now a dwelling house, the present sub post office being situated on the premises of P.H. Sissons & Sons, Joiners and Undertakers. Housing comprises the Hall, 3 farm houses, 10 council houses (some now privately owned), 6 older detached houses and 6 cottages. There are also 3 new detached properties, 2 of which are not yet completed.
